description.zh-cn: 明初四大案之一，指明太祖朱元璋诛杀宰相胡惟庸并株连功臣宿将的重大政治事件。此案导致丞相制度被废除，数万人被杀。
description.en: One of the Four Major Cases of the early Ming dynasty, referring to the major political event where the Hongwu Emperor (Zhu Yuanzhang) executed Chancellor Hu Weiyong and implicated numerous meritorious officials. This case led to the abolition of the chancellery system and the deaths of tens of thousands.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国皇帝。通过胡惟庸案，他废除了中国的丞相制度，加强了皇权。
description.en: The founding emperor of the Ming dynasty. Through the Hu Weiyong case, he abolished the chancellery system in China and consolidated imperial power.

description.zh-cn: 明朝初年的宰相，胡惟庸案的核心人物，后被朱元璋以谋反罪名诛杀。
description.en: A chancellor in the early Ming dynasty and the central figure of the Hu Weiyong case. He was later executed by the Hongwu Emperor on charges of treason.

description.zh-cn: 中国古代的最高行政官职。该职位在胡惟庸案后被朱元璋废除。
description.en: The highest administrative office in ancient China. The position was abolished by the Hongwu Emperor after the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国功臣，曾任左丞相。在胡惟庸案中受牵连被杀。
description.en: A founding father of the Ming dynasty who served as Left Chancellor. He was implicated and executed in the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝初年的中央最高行政机构，由丞相领导。胡惟庸案后被废除。
description.en: The central highest administrative body in the early Ming dynasty, led by the chancellors. It was abolished after the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝在废除丞相制度后设立的皇帝顾问机构。
description.en: An advisory body for the emperor established in the Ming dynasty after the abolition of the chancellery system.

description.zh-cn: 明初四大案之一，将军蓝玉被指控谋反，导致大规模的政治清洗。
description.en: One of the Four Major Cases of the early Ming dynasty, where General Lan Yu was accused of treason, leading to a large-scale political purge.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸案和蓝玉案的总称。
description.en: The collective term for the Hu Weiyong case and the Lan Yu case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝初年官员，曾任右丞相，在胡惟庸案前夕被朱元璋赐死。
description.en: An official in the early Ming dynasty who served as Right Chancellor and was ordered to commit suicide by the Hongwu Emperor on the eve of the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝初期以朱元璋同乡为主的官僚集团，在胡惟庸案中被清洗。
description.en: A bureaucratic clique in the early Ming dynasty primarily composed of officials from the Hongwu Emperor's hometown, which was purged during the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝初年御史大夫，被指控与胡惟庸一同谋反并被处决。
description.en: Censor-in-chief in the early Ming dynasty, accused of conspiring with Hu Weiyong and was executed.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国功臣和政治家。据《明史》记载，他被胡惟庸下毒害死。
description.en: A founding father and statesman of the Ming dynasty. According to the History of Ming, he was poisoned to death by Hu Weiyong.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国军事将领。他对胡惟庸极为厌恶，并向朱元璋密报其奸行。
description.en: A founding military general of the Ming dynasty. He deeply disliked Hu Weiyong and secretly reported his misconduct to the Hongwu Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 徐达的守门人。胡惟庸试图利诱他谋害徐达，但他将此事揭发。
description.en: Xu Da's gatekeeper. Hu Weiyong tried to bribe him to harm Xu Da, but he exposed the plot.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国功臣，封吉安侯。后因被家奴告发与胡惟庸串通谋反，被卷入胡惟庸案。
description.en: A founding father of the Ming dynasty, enfeoffed as Marquis of Ji'an. He was later implicated in the Hu Weiyong case after being accused by his servant of conspiring with Hu Weiyong.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国功臣，封平凉侯。后因与胡惟庸串通谋反被卷入胡惟庸案。
description.en: A founding father of the Ming dynasty, enfeoffed as Marquis of Pingliang. He was later implicated in the Hu Weiyong case for conspiring with Hu Weiyong.

description.zh-cn: 明朝中丞。他最初参与了胡惟庸的谋反计划，但后来向上告发，最终仍被处死。
description.en: A vice censor-in-chief of the Ming dynasty. He initially participated in Hu Weiyong's rebellion plot but later reported it to the emperor, yet was still executed.

description.zh-cn: 明朝御史中丞，告发胡惟庸谋反。
description.en: Censor-in-chief of the Ming Dynasty who exposed Hu Weiyong's rebellion plot.

description.zh-cn: 明初文学家、史学家。因其孙宋慎被牵连进胡惟庸案而受株连，被贬死于四川夔州。
description.en: A scholar and historian of the early Ming dynasty. He was implicated in the Hu Weiyong case because of his grandson Song Shen, and died in exile in Kuizhou, Sichuan.

description.zh-cn: 宋濂的孙子，因受胡惟庸案牵连被杀。
description.en: Grandson of Song Lian, who was implicated and executed in the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝靖宁侯，蓝玉的姻亲。因“交通胡惟庸”被杀，其案揭开了蓝玉案的序幕。
description.en: Marquis of Jingning of the Ming dynasty and a relative of Lan Yu by marriage. He was executed for 'communicating with Hu Weiyong', and his case served as a prelude to the Lan Yu case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝开国将领，后被指控谋反，引发蓝玉案。
description.en: A founding general of the Ming dynasty who was later accused of treason, sparking the Lan Yu case.

description.zh-cn: 明朝太监。野史记载他在胡惟庸图谋不轨时，拼死拦住朱元璋的座驾，从而揭发了阴谋，但自己也被卫兵打死。
description.en: A eunuch of the Ming dynasty. Unofficial histories record that when Hu Weiyong was plotting treason, he desperately stopped the Hongwu Emperor's carriage, thereby exposing the conspiracy, but was beaten to death by the guards himself.

description.zh-cn: 明朝洪武年间，朱元璋为整顿吏治、惩治贪赃枉法和功臣而兴的四件大案，包括胡惟庸案、蓝玉案、空印案和郭桓案。
description.en: Four major cases during the Hongwu era of the Ming dynasty, initiated by the Hongwu Emperor to rectify governance, punish corruption, and deal with meritorious officials. They include the Hu Weiyong case, the Lan Yu case, the Empty Seal case, and the Guo Huan case.

description.zh-cn: 中国古代中央行政机构中吏、户、礼、兵、刑、工六个部门的总称。在丞相被废后，六部直接对皇帝负责。
description.en: The collective term for the six central government departments in ancient China: Personnel, Revenue, Rites, War, Justice, and Works. After the abolition of the chancellery, the Six Ministries became directly responsible to the emperor.

description.zh-cn: 中国封建王朝的最高统治者。
description.en: The supreme ruler of China's imperial dynasties.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上第一个大一统的封建王朝，始置丞相一职。
description.en: The first unified imperial dynasty in Chinese history, which established the position of Chancellor.

description.zh-cn: 以“枉法诬贤”、“蠹害政治”等罪名，将时任宰相胡惟庸凌迟处死。
description.en: Executed Chancellor Hu Weiyong by lingchi (death by a thousand cuts) on charges such as 'perverting the law and framing the virtuous' and 'harming politics'.

description.zh-cn: 开国功臣李善长在胡惟庸案中被指“知逆谋不举”，受株连被杀。
description.en: The founding father Li Shanchang was implicated in the Hu Weiyong case, accused of 'knowing of the rebellion plot but failing to report it', and was subsequently executed.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸案导致了以胡惟庸、李善长为首的淮西官僚集团覆灭。
description.en: The Hu Weiyong case led to the destruction of the Huaixi bureaucratic clique, which was headed by Hu Weiyong and Li Shanchang.

description.zh-cn: 在诛杀胡惟庸后，朱元璋宣布废除丞相制度，以加强皇权。
description.en: After executing Hu Weiyong, Zhu Yuanzhang announced the abolition of the chancellery system to strengthen imperial power.

description.zh-cn: 随着丞相制度的废除，作为中央最高行政机构的中书省也被废止。
description.en: With the abolition of the chancellery system, the Zhongshu Sheng, which served as the central highest administrative body, was also abolished.

description.zh-cn: 在废除丞相后，朱元璋设立内阁作为皇帝的顾问机构。
description.en: After abolishing the chancellery, Zhu Yuanzhang established the Grand Secretariat (Neige) as an advisory body to the emperor.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸案的延续，其中靖宁侯叶升因“交通胡惟庸”被杀，此事揭开了蓝玉案的序幕。
description.en: As a continuation of the Hu Weiyong case, the execution of Marquis Ye Sheng for 'communicating with Hu Weiyong' served as the prelude to the Lan Yu case.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸案与蓝玉案合称为胡蓝党狱。
description.en: The Hu Weiyong case and the Lan Yu case are collectively known as the Hu-Lan Case.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸案与蓝玉案合称为胡蓝党狱。
description.en: The Hu Weiyong case and the Lan Yu case are collectively known as the Hu-Lan Case.

description.zh-cn: 朱元璋在胡惟庸案爆发前夕赐死右丞相汪广洋。
description.en: The Hongwu Emperor ordered Right Chancellor Wang Guangyang to commit suicide on the eve of the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 据《明史》记载，朱元璋派胡惟庸带医生探视生病的刘基（刘伯温），胡惟庸趁机对他下毒。
description.en: According to the History of Ming, the Hongwu Emperor sent Hu Weiyong with a doctor to visit the ailing Liu Ji (Liu Bowen), and Hu Weiyong took the opportunity to poison him.

description.zh-cn: 大将军徐达极其厌恶胡惟庸，并向朱元璋密报其奸行。
description.en: Grand General Xu Da deeply detested Hu Weiyong and secretly reported his villainous activities to the Hongwu Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸试图收买徐达的守门人福寿以谋害徐达，但被福寿揭发。
description.en: Hu Weiyong attempted to bribe Xu Da's gatekeeper, Fushou, to assassinate Xu Da, but Fushou exposed the plot.

description.zh-cn: 作为同谋者之一，涂节见事不成，转而告发胡惟庸谋反。
description.en: As one of the conspirators, Tu Jie reported Hu Weiyong's rebellion plot when he saw it was failing.

description.zh-cn: 御史中丞商暠也告发了胡惟庸的阴谋。
description.en: Censor-in-chief Shang Gao also exposed Hu Weiyong's conspiracy.

description.zh-cn: 因其孙宋慎卷入胡惟庸案，宋濂受到株连，被贬死于四川夔州。
description.en: Due to his grandson Song Shen's involvement in the Hu Weiyong case, Song Lian was implicated and died in exile in Kuizhou, Sichuan.

description.zh-cn: 宋濂的孙子宋慎因胡惟庸案受牵连被杀。
description.en: Song Shen, the grandson of Song Lian, was implicated and executed in the Hu Weiyong case.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸案一直延续到洪武二十五年，靖宁侯叶升因“交通胡惟庸”被杀。
description.en: The Hu Weiyong case continued until the 25th year of the Hongwu reign, when Marquis Ye Sheng of Jingning was executed for 'communicating with Hu Weiyong'.

description.zh-cn: 叶升是蓝玉的姻亲。
description.en: Ye Sheng was a relative of Lan Yu by marriage.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸于洪武六年任右丞相，后升任左丞相，独相数年。
description.en: Hu Weiyong was appointed Right Chancellor in the 6th year of the Hongwu reign, later promoted to Left Chancellor, and served as the sole chancellor for several years.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸案是明初四大案之一。
description.en: The Hu Weiyong case is one of the Four Major Cases of the early Ming dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 朱元璋废除丞相后，六部尚书直接对皇帝负责，分理天下事务。
description.en: After Zhu Yuanzhang abolished the chancellery, the ministers of the Six Ministries became directly responsible to the emperor, managing the affairs of the state.

description.zh-cn: 秦朝始置丞相，作为最高行政官职。
description.en: The Qin dynasty first established the position of Chancellor as the highest administrative office.

description.zh-cn: 根据野史记载，太监云奇拼死拦住朱元璋座驾，揭发了胡惟庸的谋反计划。
description.en: According to unofficial histories, the eunuch Yun Qi desperately stopped the Hongwu Emperor's carriage, exposing Hu Weiyong's rebellion plot.

description.zh-cn: 根据野史记载，朱元璋因云奇冲撞圣驾而大怒，命卫兵将其打死，但云奇的举动使他察觉到危险。
description.en: According to unofficial histories, the Hongwu Emperor was enraged by Yun Qi's blocking of the imperial carriage and ordered guards to beat him to death, but Yun Qi's actions alerted him to the danger.

description.zh-cn: 胡惟庸与御史大夫陈宁等人图谋起事。
description.en: Hu Weiyong plotted an uprising with Censor-in-chief Chen Ning and others.
